turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What I want to know is what happened to your cush between the time that you got up from the table and when I caught up with you in the Johnny?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I don't see where that's any of your business.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Did those two muscle heads shake you down? Swear I've seen them down at the track with Sure-shot Riley. That's it, ain't it? A gambling debt.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Where they taking us, anyway?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Probably to Spanky's headquarters down at the pier.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Good, I'm looking forward to meeting this Spanky. Give me a chance to straighten out this whole mess.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I can't wait to see that. You slay me, man.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What are they gonna do to us?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You? Dine and ditch, right?  Over ten bucks?  You're probably looking at a thumb.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: A thumb? What do you mean, like cut it off? For ten bucks?  That include the tip?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Come on, daddy-o. You haven't said a word since we started. Least you could do is make some friendly conversation.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Look, man, I don't want friendly conversation. I don't want to be your friend. I've seen your friends and I don't like them. I just want to do this thing and get back to New York in time to start my job.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Start your job? What kind of job?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Well, if you must know, bank teller at First Federal of Manhattan. I'm responsible for keeping track of hundreds, occasionally thousands of dollars.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's some long green.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Damn straight, it is. I got my own set of keys because I'm supposed to open up. So if I ain't there 8 a.m. Monday morning, there's gonna be hell to pay.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: No, tell me what's so funny.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I don't know. Bank teller. Sounds like ladies work to me.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Well, maybe I should dig around in other people's clothes for money. It's obviously been highly successful for you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hey, you'd be surprised what you find in other people's pockets. Just gotta avoid them deadbeat bank tellers. Get you every time.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I didn't start out to be a bank teller. I was gonna be a ballplayer. Even had an offer to play short for the Newark Eagles.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Why didn't you take it?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: The Negro League don't pay so good. And you're always on the road. That don't wash with Daisy.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You gave up baseball to be a bank teller? I can't latch on to that.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: At some point a man's got to get serious about his future. I'm sure you have no idea what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You're talking about giving up baseball to be a bank teller.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Bank teller's just a start. I got plans. Real plans. Not opening some Zoom-Boom Room. This time next year I'll be a loan officer.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: A loan officer?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: That's right, a loan officer.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: So you mean, if I needed some jack to get my nightclub up and running, I'd have to hype some square like you?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: How would I get a loan, anyway?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You need collateral.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Like this?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: That thing? Who'd you steal it from?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: My daddy gave me this watch.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Yeah? Who'd he steal it from?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: My daddy is dead so watch your mouth. You can say what you want about me, but don't be dragging my daddy into it. This watch means the world to me. Solid gold. Keeps perfect time.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Looks like a fake to me. Loan denied!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Ah, go chase yourself. I'll take my business elsewhere. And for future reference, you are no longer welcome at Ray's Boom-Boom Room.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: There is no Boom-Boom Room.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: When there is, you can forget about it. And I swear to God, you ever talk about my daddy again I'm gonna kick your bank-telling, loan-denying ass, you got me?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Oooh...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I think I liked you better when you kept your trap shut.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Maybe we oughta find another place.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Are you kidding? Tell me you don't want a slice of that pie right over there.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I must have left my appetite outside, which is where I think we ought to be right now.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You mean this sign? The one that says "No Coloreds Allowed." That's a good question. Ray, how come we missed the sign?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Look, ma'am, we've been driving all day. We'd just like to purchase one of those pies and we'll be on our way.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Thanks for backing me up here, Uncle Claude.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Don't Uncle Claude me. You get a load of those crackers? Couldn't be a mouthful of teeth among the bunch of 'em. Why you want to pick a fight with people like that for?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You're soft.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What'd you say?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I said you're soft.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Hey, man, don't ever call me that.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I call it like I see it, and what I see is definitely soft.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Alright. You want some pie?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah, I want some pie.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Okay then, I'm gonna walk over to that counter and get us some fucking pie.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Nice meeting you? You've been here before, haven't you?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What gave you that idea?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Oh, I don't know, maybe because our lives depend on it, I just sort of thought you knew what you were doing!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Don't get all agitated on me. I bought a bottle of rum from a couple of dudes, I heard 'em talking...

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Let me get this straight. We drove all the way down to Klan country 'cause you heard a couple of guys talking?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What are you complaining about? It worked out. Everything's cool. Now, come on, let's head down there and see what's shaking. We deserve a little reward.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Reward?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: There are people down there having fun. I want to be one of them. I want you to be one of them. On Monday you can be a bank teller if you want, but tonight you're a bootlegger with a truck full of Puerto Rican rum and a fistful of cash.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Hey, Ray. I've been looking for you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Here I am.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Guess we better get going, huh?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Still got that ten dollars?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Well, not exactly. See, I met this girl. Real nice girl. God-fearing girl. Her name's Sylvia.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That jelly you were talking to right here?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: She's in a tight spot. Her mama needs this operation, and they ain't got the money for it. Their church took up a collection but they were still short...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: So you made a generous contribution.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What can I say? When the spirit moves me.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That was mighty charitable of you, Claude. Looks like we both got fucked tonight.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: While you were upstairs doing God's work, I was getting jack-legged by a fool with four threes.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You lost all our money in a card game?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He even got my daddy's watch.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Fuck that cheap-ass watch --  I mean, how the hell are we gonna get home without any money?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We've still got 36 cases of rum. That's better than money.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I think he's hurt pretty bad.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He's dead.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Oh, man, I've never seen a dead body before!

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What do you think you're doing?! The man's been dead for two seconds! Don't you have any respect?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It ain't here.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What ain't there?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: My daddy's watch. This is the dude I was telling you about --

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Yeah, nobody puts 'em away like old what's-his-name.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Winston. His name's Winston.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Come on, Ray, better get Winston back to the truck.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Would you look at that, Ray. Winston up and died on us.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hell with him then. If he can't share the driving, he can't ride in the truck.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Man, this is gonna delay everything. Spanky's gonna be pissed.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Spanky's gonna be pissed? Poor Spanky. Fuck Spanky! What the hell kind of a name is Spanky, anyway? You're responsible for this situation. I blame you for everything. If it wasn't for you, I'd be home having a hot meal right now.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: If it wasn't for me, you'd be washing up on the beach at Coney Island right now.  "I need all my thumbs and fingers for praying and doing good."

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Life?! How long is life? We were just walking back to the truck. We didn't do nothing! Fuck life!

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Life?! What's life mean? There's no way I can do life. I got a job starts Monday morning!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I wouldn't do that if I was you.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Shut up. It's too damn hot. What do you know, anyway?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Why do you think they call him Jangle Leg?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Somebody just told me he wins the three-legged race every year.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He does it all by himself.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: This fork is filthy.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: The fork is the least of your worries, Claude.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What a second, you've been in here since you were thirteen?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What about you, Radio?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I kinda lost track of how many people we killed that night. Must have been 15 or twenty -- not counting women and children. It was a real bloodbath. All that screaming...

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Pack of lies. Don't listen to him. We didn't kill nobody. We were railroaded. And we gonna prove that.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He just blocked it out. Nigger's crazy. He's the one who did all the stabbing. He's capable of some heinous shit.  How 'bout him down there?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: No, man. I want you to have it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Wait up there, Claude. You give that guy your corn bread and the next thing you know you'll be ironing his shirts and clipping his toenails.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Cookie drew me a map to Greenville.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You know what I'm saying.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Yeah, I know what your saying. And I'm saying if you made it that far, they'd be watching every train that pulls out of that station.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's why we won't take the train. Cookie showed me where there's a farm house. They got a boat there.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What do you know about boats? I bet you can't even swim.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What I know about boats is they take you to freedom. Come on, man. I think we can do this.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Why are you always talking about we? There is no we. There is a me, there is a you. But there is no we between us.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You want out of this place, don't you? Don't tell me you're starting to like it here.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: No, I don't like it here. Look around. There's nothing but ass. Male ass! Balls and ass! Believe you me, I'm getting out of here.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm not gonna forget it. What does that mean? If you've got a plan, I think I have a right to know about it. I told you my plan.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Getting a map from a chubby chef named Cookie? Dragging our asses through the swamps in search of some worm-eaten boat? That ain't a plan, that's a vacation for two in the hole. When you've got a map to New York City, you get back to me.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Maynard Banks, Esquire. Attorney at law.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Gimme that. That doesn't concern you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm sure it don't.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What's up, Ray?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Claude.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Sure is hot today. Think it'll rain later?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What do you want, Claude?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What do I want? What makes you think I want something?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: My daddy always said when a man starts talking about the weather keep you hand on your wallet.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Your daddy must have been a helluva guy, a deep man, a wise man. Sure wish I could have met him --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Cut the bullshit. What do you want, Claude?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You still got that map?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Well, if you're still thinking about booking it, I want in. I think we can make it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We? Did I hear you say we? As I recall, you're the one who said there is no we. Guess we got some bad news in that letter, huh?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Look, my cousin Maynard is a lawyer. He filed an appeal on my behalf --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: On your behalf. What happened to we?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: The appeal was denied. Then Daisy went and fell for Maynard. They're engaged to be married, can you believe that?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Well, let's just think about that for a moment. He's a successful lawyer up in New York City and you're down here with a bright future in the cotton picking business. Eeny, meeny, miney, Maynard.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Come on, man. Don't shut me out. I'm telling you, you and me, that map, we can go places.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You know what, Claude? This whole time we've been down here, you've done nothing but think about yourself, acting like this whole thing is my fault. That plan with your cousin, did that include me?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: At least you're honest for once. So now you want to be my friend? Well, let me tell you something, Claude-my- shit-don't-stink-Banks. You got a lot to learn about friendship.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Does that mean I'm in?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I don't think so, Claude. You'd just slow me down. We'd have to stop every five minutes so you could polish your silverware. There's no way around it, you're soft.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What'd you say?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I said you're soft.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Don't call me that. You know I hate it when you call me that.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You did it, man! You got us out! Next stop, New York City!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: New York's a long way's off. Let's just keep moving, okay?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I know these trees all look the same, but I'm getting an awful familiar vibration from this one right here. You sure you know where we're going?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Absolutely. The map is very clear.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Let me take a look at that map.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You call this a map? What was Cookie smoking when he drew this?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Cookie didn't draw it. I did.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You drew this?!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I knew you wouldn't come if I didn't have a map.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: That gripes my soul, man. We're out here in the middle of nowhere. There is shit nibbling at my balls! Don't tell me you don't know where we're going!

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Come on, Ray, time to go!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm stuck!

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Don't mention it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hell, you'd probably be half way to New York by now...

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I'm serious, man. Don't mention it. Ever.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Keep it together, Claude. You wake up the man, he'll shoot you for sure.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: He'd be doing me a favor. I'm getting outta here one way or the other! Goddamn rats and shit! Fuck!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: All right, man, just settle down. We'll get outta here, Claude. We'll get outta here real soon.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: How the fuck are we gonna do that, Ray?!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We'll just get off at the next stop.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Say what?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's right, we'll get off at the next stop. The train's pulling into the station right now.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: The hell you talking about? What train?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We're in the Bronx, my man. Hundred and Sixty First Street.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Hundred and Sixty First Street? That's Yankee Stadium.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hell, yes, Yankee Stadium. Bombers are playing a double-header against the Red Sox.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Red Sox... Who's on the mound?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I don't know. Who do you want?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Allie Reynolds. He's my boy.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Sure, it says Allie Reynolds right here in the program. He's warming up right now. Man, we're so close to the field I need cleats. How'd you get such good seats?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I know people.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: They must be the right people. Whoa, there goes the hot dog man. Let's get a couple. Damn, that smells good. Nothing like a ballpark hot dog, huh?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You get ketchup?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Ketchup? Who eats ketchup on a hot dog? Mustard's what you want.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I can't eat it with mustard.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Give me back that hot dog. I'll eat it myself.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What am I gonna eat?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You can starve to death for all I care. Now shut up, the game's about to start.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Hey, man, is Babe Ruth in the lineup today?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Of course, he's in the lineup. There he goes right there. Hey, Babe...!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What you're dealing with here is a complete lack of talent.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I'm sick of watching Camp 12 win the championship. Every year they get to roast the victory pig and we get dick. This year I want that pig.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You want to hit?  Yo, Claude. Give Can't Get Right a shot.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Him?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Can't be worse than any of these other fools.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: All right, grab the bat. Let's see what you can do.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Judge must have money riding on the championship.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Don't matter who Camp 12 puts on the mound. All I know is when this season's over Camp 8's gonna have pork chops.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: It's amazing what Ray here can do with a couple of pounds of potato skins and some molasses.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: So, Blocker, what do you think of our boy?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What about us? Don't forget to mention us.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We're like his handlers. He can't function without us.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: God may have given it, but Claude Banks spotted it and nurtured it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Damn straight. I expect those Pittsburgh Crawdads to remember that.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Crawfords.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It's a pardon from the governor.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Let me see that.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Let it go, Claude.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I'm not gonna let it go. The man needs to explain himself. Makin' promises.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You show them Crawfords how to play ball.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Make 'em throw strikes.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: One of the new kids said they're farming those acres just north of the swamp. He said he saw a crop duster flying around the place.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I'm not in the mood right now, Ray.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He said they keep it parked out behind the barn. Can't be that hard to fly a plane. Lots of people do it.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: They're called pilots! I'm serious, Ray. I'm not in the mood for one of your stupid, fucked-up plans right now.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I don't see you coming up with any plans.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: My plan is on his way to Pittsburgh right now. That congenital idiot just got himself a pardon signed by the governor thanks to us, but we can't seem to do nothing for ourselves. Don't you feel a little disgusted right now?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Crop duster.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I ain't getting in no airplane with you. I'm finally wrapping my mind around the concept. They threw us in this shithole for life. Don't you get it, Ray? We're gonna die here! Might as well head up to the cemetery, pick a plot and start digging.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: My daddy died in prison. He gave up hope and hung himself. What you're talking about is the same damn thing. That ain't how I'm going.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Maybe you're fooling yourself, Ray. Maybe you're just a chip off the old block.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Take that back or we ain't friends no more, Claude Banks.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Here's a news flash, Ray. We never were friends. We've just been stuck together for 12 years. It's been nothing but bad luck since the moment I ran into you. Every time I look at you I get sick to my stomach thinking about what my life could have been if I'd never bumped into Ray Gibson.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Better watch yourself Claude, before you say something you regret.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: The only thing I regret is the day I met you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Well, if that's the way it is...

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: That's the way it is.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Then I have nothing left to say to you.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You're a sucker. I'd have taken that deal.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Excuse me? Are you talking to me?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I'd have knocked you off those bottles, put a bullet in your ass and be half way to New York right now.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: After all these years of blissful silence, I almost forgot how annoying the sound of your voice can be.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I hope you don't think I owe you anything. Because I don't owe you a damn thing.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I didn't do if for you, anyway. I just ain't no boot-licking trusty, that's all.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I was sorry to hear about your mama passing.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That was five years ago.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I know, but since we're talking, I thought I'd mention it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We're not talking, you're talking, and doing too damn much of it, if you ask me.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You sure looked funny running for those pies, bullets flying all around you.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Bullets weren't the problem. That pie was too hot. Burned my tongue.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You and Wilkins sure are getting chummy. You two planning on going steady, or something?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: He's just a lonely old man. He likes to talk.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hey, I'm a lonely old man. I like to talk, too. So why don't we start by talking about what kind of a plan you're working on?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I'm not working on a plan.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You can't fool me, Claude. I know you got something brewing.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Goodnight, Ray.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Don't touch that car.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Wilkins' driver's got the flu, so he asked me to fill in for him.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You haven't driven in 40 years, you ain't even got a license. Man's taking his life in his hands, putting you behind the wheel! Where you taking him?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Greenville. We're picking up the new Superintendent at the bus station.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Damn, it was getting hot in there.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What the hell are you doing in that trunk?!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You didn't think I was gonna let you escape alone, did you?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I ain't escaping! We're picking up the new super just like I told you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Then you're lucky I came along. Doesn't take a visionary to spot a golden opportunity like this. Now help me out of this trunk.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You ain't getting out of that trunk.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Come on, man, I'm starting to cramp up here.  We have the chance right here, right now, I say we go!

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Go where, Ray?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Back to New York for starters.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: And what will we do when we get there? I'm sixty-five years old, Ray. So are you. What are we gonna do out here? Get married, have kids, settle down? That boat sailed without us, man.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: This boat's gonna sail without you, too. I don't care if I last one day out here. At least it's one day of freedom. Now gimme those keys.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Forget about that. You run if you want to, but you're not taking this car.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Claude, man, I'm serious. Give me those keys.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I ain't spending a month in the hole so you can take a joy ride.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Don't make me take them away from you.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Hey, there's Wilkins!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You sure it was him?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Some faces you just don't forget. Warren Pike's is one of 'em.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I don't like it, I don't like it one bit. We shoulda taken that car when we had the opportunity. We'd be half way to New York by now.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: We'd be in the hole by now. Hey, man, you're peeing on my shoe.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I know. Simultaneously, they shake and zip. Claude bends down and picks up a bowl of gumbo, placing it on a tray next to an identical one.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Don't shoot, sir. I can deal with this.  Ray, buddy, you don't want to shoot this white man. See, you do that, they'll kill you for sure. And it's not that I like you or anything, but I've kinda gotten used to having you around.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He's got my daddy's watch, Claude. I always knew whoever took that watch killed Winston Hancock. And that was you, Mr. Pike.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No, I'm gonna kill him --

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: No, believe me, I'm gonna kill him!

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I can't do it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's because you're soft. Gimme the gun.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What'd you say?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I said you're soft.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Don't call me soft, I hate it when you call me that.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Why don't he just tell 'em the truth?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He knows nobody wants to hear the truth.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Nurse Humphries was checking my prostate this morning. I got an erection.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: An erection, huh? Haven't had one of those in a while.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Tell me about it. Scared me at first. Then, before I could figure out what to do with it, it was gone. Imagine my disappointment.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Sure would like to see the house that Ruth built one more time.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Well, Ruth shoulda built it a little better. Damn thing's falling to pieces. Gonna hurt somebody.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: What do you expect? It's almost as old as we are.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: They oughta tear that shit down and ship them Yankees cross the river to Jersey.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Remember what that place looked like on a sunny spring day? More beautiful than any church I was ever in.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Over to the morgue and up the hill to the cemetery. Never thought I'd admit it, Claude, but you were right.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: 'Course I was right. About what?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You're the one who said that boneyard's the only way we're getting out of here. We're gonna join all the rest of 'em soon enough. Jangle Leg, Biscuit, Goldmouth, Poker Face, Cookie, Radio -- yes sir, pick a plot and start digging...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Are you trying to tell me after all this time you finally have a plan for busting out of here?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Shh! Is that so hard to believe?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Don't tell me, I don't want to hear it. It's probably all fucked up, anyway.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You don't want to hear it, you don't want to hear it. There's no shame in that.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It's too late for plans.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Never thought I'd hear Ray Gibson say that. Hell with you then. You'd only slow me down anyway.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I can't eat this.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Why the hell not?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I saw that hot dog guy in the bathroom urinating. He didn't wash his hands.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Just put some mustard on it and eat it.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You didn't get ketchup?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Gimme that damn thing.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hell of a day for a ballgame, huh, Claude?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Hell of a day, Ray. Yankees are on fire.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: No, this ain't gonna work either. It's half chocolate, half vanilla.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: They're touching.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: If you don't eat that ice cream right now, I'm gonna strangle you until you are completely dead.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Yeah? You and what army?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Next thing, you're gonna be complaining about the seats.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Well, if you must know, they could be closer.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Damn, I shoulda let Spanky Johnson drown you in the river when I had the chance.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I know you're not talking to me...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm sorry, he's on medication...

turns.speaker: JANGLE LEG
turns.text: How you doin'?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I'm all right.

turns.speaker: JANGLE LEG
turns.text: You ever done time before?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You kidding? I've been in and out of prison my entire life. Mostly in. I'm hard-core.

turns.speaker: JANGLE LEG
turns.text: Then you won't have no problem making the adjustment. You need anything, help of any kind, gimme a holler. Name's Jangle Leg.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: 'Preciate it. Claude.

turns.speaker: JANGLE LEG
turns.text: Soft and supple. Like a lady's.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I try to moisturize regularly.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: Creamed chip beef on toast. Except we're outta beef, so I had to improvise.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Can't I get one of those steaks you got grilling back there?

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: Those are for trusties, unless you got thirty cents or two packs of cigs.

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: At least he didn't kill Santa Claus with his bare hands.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You killed Santa Claus?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Alright, well, let's say you make it to Greenville. What's there, anyway?

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: Grandma Dodi's Pork Rib Joint.

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: You got your own nightclub?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Well, not yet. It's still in the planning stages.

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: Ray, my man, this steak is like butter!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Made just for you, Cookie.

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: How about some steak sauce?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No problem. Oh, boy!

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: Why ain't his pick swinging?

turns.speaker: HOPPIN' BOB
turns.text: Why ain't that pick swinging?

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: Too hot, huh? Well, you tell that lazy jiggaboo the state of Mississippi ain't interested in his meteorological assessments.

turns.speaker: HOPPIN' BOB
turns.text: Listen up, jiggaboo! State of Mississippi ain't interested in your... in your...  metropolitan assets!

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: Tell him the state of Mississippi is only interested in getting this ditch cleared by sundown.

turns.speaker: HOPPIN' BOB
turns.text: State of Mississippi wants this ditch cleared by sundown. You got that?!

turns.speaker: HOPPIN' BOB
turns.text: He's from New York City. That one, too.

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: New York. That's up north, ain't it? They'll find we do things different down here.

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: Looks like we got a couple of live ones. How long these boys in for?

turns.speaker: HOPPIN' BOB
turns.text: Judge gave 'em the long ride.

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: Life, huh? They step outta line again, we'll shorten up that sentence real fast.

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: We lost yesterday on accounta the rain. That means we gotta make up for it today, so put your backs to it.

turns.speaker: HOPPIN' BOB
turns.text: You heard the boss! Let's move!

turns.speaker: HOPPIN' BOB
turns.text: All in, boss!

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: Move it out.

turns.speaker: HOPPIN' BOB
turns.text: Movin' it out, boss.

turns.speaker: HOPPIN' BOB
turns.text: We don't need no fences at Camp 8, boss.

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: That's right. We don't need no fences, we have the gun line. It runs from shack to shack clear around the yard. You are now inside the gun line...

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: Alright, listen up! I want every man lined up out here in the yard on the double! Let's move it!

turns.speaker: HOPPIN' BOB
turns.text: You heard what the man said! Move it!

turns.speaker: GOLDMOUTH
turns.text: Maybe I oughta eat your corn bread.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: My corn bread? Oh no, my friend. I love corn bread.

turns.speaker: GOLDMOUTH
turns.text: So it don't exist.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Just because it's in my mind, Goldmouth, don't mean it ain't real. Everything worth anything starts with a dream.

turns.speaker: GOLDMOUTH
turns.text: You mean Louis Armstrong?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He's a good friend of mine. Drops by the club whenever he's in town.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's right, fellas. Catch any cab heading uptown. All the drivers know Ray's Boom-Boom Room.

turns.speaker: GOLDMOUTH
turns.text: Hey, Ray...

turns.speaker: GOLDMOUTH
turns.text: Where am I at, man?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: C'mon, Goldmouth, somebody's gotta watch the front door.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Hey, the dude's holdin'.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Come on, old-timer, hook the brothers up.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Hell of a way to get out. Heard they burned up in that fire yesterday.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I seen the bodies before they sealed 'em up. Them fellas sizzled up good. Looked like some shit from the X- Files.  Damn, that shit's nasty.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: So Ray and Claude got their pardons, right?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: No, they didn't get their pardons, you dumb shit! If they'd got their pardons way back then, we wouldn't be burying them today, would we?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Oh, right. Well, why didn't they get those pardons?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That musta messed 'em up pretty bad.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: What happened to 'em after that, Willie?
